Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; creamy white slip; interior: glazed black with reserved band at rim; lotus flower and palmette in added red and added white; exterior: broken maeander pattern between pairs of bands at rim; painted decoration consisting of head of a spear in silhouette and part of a hand in outline, to right.
Curator's comments: Lemos does not specifically place this sherd in her Group with the Filling Ornament and there is no evidence for any filling ornament on the sherd. However, like most sherds from this group, the male is depicted in outline and not with coloured skin. Perhaps this sherd also belongs in this group.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 272, no. 705, pl. I, pl. 92)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0797) (phase 2)
